schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Statistics and Probability – role of statistics, population vs. sample, data types, graphical representation of data.
Week 2: Measures of Central Tendency – mean, median, mode, interpretation, and comparison.
Week 3: Measures of Dispersion – variance, standard deviation, mean absolute deviation.
Week 4: Skewness and Kurtosis – Pearson’s coefficient of skewness, moment coefficients, interpretation.
Week 5: Fundamentals of Probability – events, probability functions, axioms of probability.
Week 6: Conditional Probability and Independence – multiplication rule, independent events.
Week 7: Random Variables – discrete and continuous variables, probability mass/density functions, expectation, variance.
Week 8: Joint and Marginal Distributions – joint probability tables, marginal probability, conditional distributions.
Week 9: Special Discrete Distributions I – Bernoulli, Binomial, Poisson distributions.
Week 10: Special Discrete Distributions II – Hypergeometric distribution and applications.
Week 11: Normal Distribution – empirical rule, Chebyshev’s inequality, z-scores, standard normal tables.
Week 12: Sampling Distributions – sampling distribution of the mean, central limit theorem.
Week 13: Chi-square Distribution – variance testing, independence tests.
Week 14: t-Distribution – mean estimation, hypothesis testing.
Week 15: F-Distribution – variance ratio tests, introduction to ANOVA.
Week 16: Gamma Distribution – relationship to exponential and chi-square distributions.
Week 17: Linear Transformations and Subscores – standardization, scaling, effects on mean and variance.
Week 18: Review and Applications – integrated exercises, project presentations, exam preparation.
